column5: hello just wanted to ask you guys if you know of any guides that you could recommend. i have never hired a guide before, and would like to experience it. i would like to go for steelhead and salmon. is spring a good time to hit the niagara river?  and also if you could share your experience with the fishing in the river itself is a lot of help. i fished the gorge once and i was skunked. wasn't used to fishing that kind of current.  thanks for any info guys....tight lines
Try Natural Wonders angling. Joe is top shelf. another would be Paul Castalano bothare very knowledgable guides.
I've been out with Paul from Cast Adventures, and he is honestly one of the best all around anglers I have ever seen. Give him a try, you'll see what I'm talking about. Darcy
I would give Wayne Lovett a call at 905-427-2574. Great Lakes Sportfishing Guide Services
another vote for Joe @ Natural Wonders he has 2 boats, a big Lund for the river & a bigger Thompson trolling boat for Lake O
Anyone know if Aaron Shirley is still guiding? I heard he was top notch!
I'd recommend Steve Piggott. Angler's Way  He's a great guide and has great equipment.
Paul puts fish in the boat, Frank is Just as good but I bet their both booked solid
ditto. ive been out many times with paul he is top notch

LOL......Happy New Year Pigeontroller!  Yes i'll second that, Frank is a great guide!  Spinnerdoc,  all the guides in the Niagara Region are really good! You'll be in good hands with any of the recommended names in this post! Good luck!
thanks guys i'm looking forward to booking one just have to figure out when....again thanks for the info guys
and that is one sad fact
The best part of booking a Canadian guide is that we work together sharing information with each other to put our clients on the fish Like Paul said all good people.
Well I hope you got all the info you needed spinnerdoc.
